title: 105_s2072
content: The text discusses the permanent extension of the research credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, with amendments to sections 41 and 45C. The effective date for these changes is after June 30, 1998. The text discusses amendments to the fixed-base percentage definition under section 41(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for calculating research expenses. It also addresses the fixed-base percentage for start-up companies under section 41(c)(3)(B). The amendment to section 41(c)(3)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code changes the criteria for determining the fixed-base percentage for taxpayers who did not have both gross receipts and qualified research expenses in each of the 10 taxable years. Additionally, the amendment in section 41(c)(3)(C) states that the maximum fixed-base percentage does not apply to taxpayers meeting the criteria in subparagraph (B). The amendment in section 41(c)(3)(C) of the Internal Revenue Code repeals the minimum base amount for start-up companies and makes conforming amendments to section 41(c)(3)(B)(ii). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude certain taxpayers from a specific paragraph. Additionally, the limitation on contract research expenses is repealed, with amendments applying to taxable years starting after December 31, 1998. Taxpayers in their first five taxable years after this date can choose to apply the previous version of the Code. SEC. 3. MODIFICATIONS OF BASIC RESEARCH CREDIT. Expansion of Credit to Research Done With National Laboratories and Federal Research Centers. This amendment allows organizations that are national laboratories specified by the Secretary of Energy or federally funded research and development centers to qualify for tax credits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment allows national laboratories and federal research centers to qualify for tax credits under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Research with specific commercial objectives is exempt from the amendment if results are made public before commercial use or if it is conducted for a consortium of domestic corporations. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 1998.
